properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 2:27PM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Accumulating Snow Followed by Bitter Cold and Windy Conditions
Overnight into Thursday Morning...

.A winter storm system will continue to spread snow northward
across eastern Iowa and northwest Illinois late this afternoon.
The snow will be followed by a strong cold front, which will bring
bitter cold temperatures and strong winds tonight into Thursday.
Snowfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected across northeast
Missouri, portions of eastern Iowa and northwest Illinois. Strong
northwest will cause blowing and drifting snow and lead to wind
chill index readings as low as 15 below to 25 below zero late
tonight into Thursday morning.

* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as
25 below zero.

* WHERE...Dubuque and Jones Counties.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong northwest winds will cause blowing
and drifting of light snow, leading to hazardous travel
conditions.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY
